title: Strategies for Managing Teacher Orchestration Load in [Large-Scale] CSCL Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematical knowledge and digital device utilization skills
context.additional_context: A classroom environment where professionals participate as learners, and collaborative learning using digital devices takes place

learning_goals: Learners can explain core components of teacher orchestration in CSCL environments (planning-execution-monitoring-adjustment)
Learners can compare structured (PyramidApp) and flexible (EthicApp) tools and suggest context-appropriate tool selection strategies
Learners can apply orchestration load analysis methods using multimodal data (observation records, physiological indicators, self-reports)
Learners can identify cognitive/physical load factors during collaborative learning and design mitigation strategies
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
